page.title:
ZOMETA® Overview
ZOMETA® Z O M E T A ®
Overview
page.enlisting:
▪ ZOMETA belongs to a new class of highly potent ▪ Treatment of hypercalcemia of malignancy – Approved by FDA in August 2001 – Approved in over 60 countries ▪ Treatment of bone metastases – Filed July 2001 in EU and August 2001 in US and – Dose: Zoledronic acid 4 mg infused over 15 min ▪ Non-oncologic uses under evaluation – Paget’s disease, osteoporosis, rheumatoid arthritis ▪ ZOMETA belongs to a new class of highly potent
▪ ZOMETA belongs to a new class of highly potent ▪ Z O M E T A

page.title:
IN-4
IN-4
page.normal_text:
ZOMETA® in Bone Metastases Proposed Indication
ZOMETA® in Bone Metastases Z O M E T A ® i n
B o n e
M e t a s t a s e s
Proposed Indication

ZOMETA (zoledronic acid) is indicated for the treatment of osteolytic, osteoblastic, and mixed bone metastases of solid tumors and osteolytic lesions of multiple myeloma, in conjunction with standard antineoplastic therapy
ZOMETA (zoledronic acid) is
indicated for the treatment of
osteolytic, osteoblastic, and mixed
bone metastases of solid tumors
and osteolytic lesions of multiple
myeloma, in conjunction with
standard antineoplastic therapy
